parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate or party. It focuses on a local environmental issue concerning the cutting down of trees in IOR park.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement targeting a wide audience in Bucharest, aiming to recruit volunteers for a park protection initiative.  The reach estimate is 100K-500K, indicating a broad reach.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to mobilize volunteers to protect trees in IOR park, not to influence votes in the parliamentary elections. The content is focused on a local environmental issue and a call to action for community involvement.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. While the post presents information about the situation in IOR park, it's primarily a call to action rather than a journalistic piece. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality typically associated with journalism. However, it does raise awareness of a public issue.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post doesn't express a personal opinion unrelated to the call to action. The content is directly related to the mobilization effort for protecting the park.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2281651368860783</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while politically categorized due to its presence on a public platform and paid promotion, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post focuses on a local environmental issue (tree cutting in IOR park) and calls for community action to protect the park. It does not mention any parliamentary candidates, parties, or attempt to influence voting behavior in the parliamentary elections. The call to action is for volunteer participation in a park protection initiative, not for voting for a specific candidate or party.  The content is primarily focused on a local environmental concern and citizen mobilization, not on influencing the outcome of the parliamentary elections.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
